Author: h6y34ui98#1695
Content: I started using agama for kmd and arrr in full mode. What I noticed is that I can bypass the pin by adding kmd and/or arrr, let it sync and voila, I‚Äôm presented with both balances ( kmd and arrr). What‚Äôs the recommended way to prevent this? Apart from that everything works fine.

Author: h6y34ui98#1695
Content: Full mode = native mode

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Current functionality of pin in native mode is just saved coins preset protection but not wallet.dat access restriction

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: Was it this or next week the realese of mobile dex? Am a bit confused about the wording in the announcement.

Author: h6y34ui98#1695
Content: @TonyL I'm thinking of creating a symlink for the wallet directory to a luks encrypted disk/usb? Would that be a feasible option?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/encrypt-wallet.html#how-to-encrypt-komodo-wallet-dat-with-password-to-make-it-more-secure there is a `encryptwallet` call for thing which you expected from Agama

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: But I advice you to make unencrypted wallet copy first (you can place it in some cold storage)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/1ql2do/350_bitcoins_encrypted_walletdat_deleted_lost/ there is a lot of sad stories like this, so be careful with wallet.dat manipulations

Author: h6y34ui98#1695
Content: @TonyL Thanks for that. That's helpful and would sort out security for kmd. However, ARRR is not based on a ac_public chain and this wallet only holds z-addresses. So, that's a no-go for ARRR, unfortunately.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Hold most on some cold storage, smaller sum too which you might need access fast store in hot storage, thats my advice

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Thats how exchanges do for example

Author: h6y34ui98#1695
Content: Hmmh, that's exactly what I previously did with kmd, until the new version of agama removed that feature üòâ But, yeah, I agree to put the bulk of coins back into cold storage and store that in an encrypted area somewhere safe. Good advice!
